title: moveEZ
text: Using previously created PCA biplot object bp, moveplot() function enables animation sample points time. function piped several key arguments: time.var: Specifies name variable dataset represents temporal sequential dimension. case, variable ‚ÄúYear‚Äù relates time variable. group.var: Indicates grouping variable used colour-coding. case, variable ‚ÄúRegion‚Äù relates group variable. hulls: logical flag determines whether display individual sample points draw convex hulls around group. move: critical argument controls whether biplot animated. set TRUE, sample points animated across time. set FALSE, function returns faceted plot showing static biplot time level. design provides flexibility exploring temporal dynamics multivariate data, options animated comparative static visualisations.

title: moveEZ
code: bp |> moveplot(time.var = "Year", group.var = "Region", hulls = TRUE, move = FALSE) #> Object of class biplot, based on 960 samples and 9 variables. #> 6 numeric variables. #> 3 categorical variables.

title: moveEZ
text: moveplot2() function extends animation sample points variable axes. Unlike moveplot(), keeps variable axes fixed, moveplot2() constructs separate biplot time slice, allowing components evolve time. function shares arguments moveplot(), move argument determining whether animation shown presented static facets samples variables.

title: moveEZ
text: move FALSE, faceted plot returned, showing biplot time point. , sample coordinates variable axes differ across facets, reflecting temporal changes data structure. noticeable discontinuity transition year 1950 1960. 1960 onwards, however, biplots appear well-aligned. address inconsistencies, moveplot2() function provides two additional arguments ‚Äî align.time reflect ‚Äî enable alignment optional axis reflections biplots specified time points, resulting smoother coherent animations.
code: bp |> moveplot2(time.var = "Year", group.var = "Region", hulls = TRUE, move = FALSE) #> Object of class biplot, based on 960 samples and 9 variables. #> 6 numeric variables. #> 3 categorical variables.

title: moveEZ
text: Setting move TRUE produces animated biplot samples variables transition across time, offering dynamic view structural shifts multivariate space. example , align biplot 1950 time point apply reflection x-axis. Available options include: ‚Äúx‚Äù ‚Äì Reflect x-axis ‚Äúy‚Äù ‚Äì Reflect y-axis ‚Äúxy‚Äù ‚Äì Reflect axes course, align.time reflect can vectors alignment needed multiple time points. entry reflect corresponds time point align.time, allowing fine-grained control alignment orientation biplots across animation sequence.

what: Dynamic frame with alignment to a target with moveplot3()
title: moveEZ
text: function shares arguments moveplot() moveplot2(), addition target argument. moveplot3() utilises Generalised Orthogonal Procrustes Analysis (GPA) (Gower Dijksterhuis (2004)) align sample points variable axes either specified target (example: measurements different time point) centroid coordinate matrix representing sample points axes across time slices (target = NULL). GPA applied using GPAbin package makes use admissible transformations (translation, scaling, rotation reflection) optimally align configurations, preserving distances coordinates. moveplot2() move argument determines whether animations changing sample points variables axes shown presented static facets. illustrate use fixed target, use year 1989 Africa_climate data set, consists variables number observations:

previous_headings: Dynamic frame with alignment to a target with moveplot3()
what: Facet: move = FALSE and target = NULL
title: moveEZ
text: separate biplots per time.var transformed aligned centroid coordinate matrix observed sample points axes variables.
code: bp |> moveplot3(time.var = "Year", group.var = "Region", hulls = TRUE, move = FALSE,                 target = NULL) #> Object of class biplot, based on 960 samples and 9 variables. #> 6 numeric variables. #> 3 categorical variables.

previous_headings: Dynamic frame with alignment to a target with moveplot3()
what: Facet: move = FALSE and target = Africa_climate_target
title: moveEZ
text: Now, separate biplots per time.var transformed aligned sample points axes variables 1989 Africa_climate dataset. Take note: target biplot shown. example showcases difference observations variables year Africa_climate compared 1989.
code: bp |> moveplot3(time.var = "Year", group.var = "Region", hulls = TRUE, move = FALSE,                  target = Africa_climate_target) #> Object of class biplot, based on 960 samples and 9 variables. #> 6 numeric variables. #> 3 categorical variables.

title: moveEZ
text: Finally, animated biplots illustrate transformations towards specified target dataset. , focus movement changes variables sample representation target set specific year compared movement observed previous example target = NULL. Therefore, animations expose jumps occur 1989 years Africa_climate 1950 2020 (increments 10 years).

title: moveEZ
text: function can used conjunction moveplot3(). Five measures comparison calculated establish differences individual biplot chosen target configuration specified moveplot3(). measures based Orthogonal Procrustes analysis target specific individual biplot. three bias related measures: Absolute Mean Bias (AMB), Mean Bias (MB) Root Mean Squared Bias (RMSB). two fit measures: Procrustes Statistic (PS) Congruence Coefficient (CC). information metrics refer Nienkemper-Swanepoel, Roux, Gardner-Lubbe (2023). evaluation measures can extracted follows:  ease interpretation, especially large number time points, separate line plots available fit bias measures.

title: moveEZ
text: Procrustes Statistics(PS) Congruence Coefficient (CC) bounded zero one. small PS value (close zero) large CC value (close one) indicate good fit. measures express magnitude changes made particular biplot match target visualisation. Therefore, measure close coordinates two configurations .  line plot shows biplot 2000 results lower CC larger PS value compared years. means noticeable difference year 2000 average across years measurements 2000 investigated detail understand cause difference.
code: results$fit.plot

title: moveEZ
text: Low values Absolute Mean Bias (AMB), Mean Bias (MB) Root Mean Squared Bias (RMSB) reflect unbiased representation biplot target matched .  line plot shows initial bias high, decreases stabilises 1960 increase AMB RMSB occurring 2000. agreement fit measures. MB stays constant close zero comparisons.

code: library(devtools) install_github("MuViSU/moveEZ")

title: Animated Biplots
text: Consider dataset ùêó{\mathbf{X}} comprising nn observations pp continuous variables, along additional variable representing ‚Äútime.‚Äù time variable need correspond chronological time; just well represent another form ordered index, algorithmic iterations experimental stages. natural approach construct separate biplots level time variable, enabling user explore samples variable relationships evolve across time. However, time variable includes many levels, quickly results overwhelming number biplots. package addresses challenge animating single biplot across levels time variable, allowing dynamic visualisation temporal sequential changes data. animation biplots‚Äîcurrently limited PCA biplots‚Äîbased two conceptual frameworks: Fixed Variable Frame moveplot(): biplot first constructed using full dataset ${\bf{X}}$, animation achieved slicing observations according ‚Äútime‚Äù variable. approach, variable axes remain fixed, sample points animated time. Dynamic Frame moveplot2() moveplot3(): Separate biplots constructed time slice data. sample points variable axes evolve time, resulting fully dynamic animation reflects temporal changes underlying data structure. differences functions highlighted subsequent sections. Please look vignettes full illustration functions work.

what: Measures of comparison for move plot 3 ‚Äî evaluation
title: Measures of comparison for move plot 3 ‚Äî evaluation
text: function calculates measures comparison generalised orthogonal Procrustes Analysis performed moveplot3. Orthogonal Procrustes Analysis used compare target testee configuration. following measures calculate: Procrustes Statistic (PS), Congruence Coefficient (CC), Absolute Mean Bias (AMB), Mean Bias (MB) Root Mean Squared Bias (RMSB).

title: Measures of comparison for move plot 3 ‚Äî evaluation
code: evaluation(bp, centring = TRUE)

title: Measures of comparison for move plot 3 ‚Äî evaluation
text: bp biplot object moveEZ centring logical argument apply centring (default TRUE)

title: Measures of comparison for move plot 3 ‚Äî evaluation
text: eval.list Returns list containing measures comparison level time variable. fit.plot Returns line plot fit measures bounded zero one: PS CC. small PS value large CC value indicate good fit. bias.plot Returns line plot bias measures taht unbounded: AMB, MB RMSB. Small values indicate low bias.

title: Measures of comparison for move plot 3 ‚Äî evaluation
code: data(Africa_climate) data(Africa_climate_target) bp <- biplotEZ::biplot(Africa_climate, scaled = TRUE) |> biplotEZ::PCA() results <- bp |> moveplot3(time.var = "Year", group.var = "Region", hulls = TRUE, move = FALSE, target = NULL) |> evaluation()  results$eval.list #> [[1]] #>      Target vs. 1950 #> PS            0.1323 #> CC            0.9697 #> AMB           1.2717 #> MB            0.0000 #> RMSB          1.8506 #>  #> [[2]] #>      Target vs. 1960 #> PS            0.0982 #> CC            0.9763 #> AMB           0.4414 #> MB            0.0000 #> RMSB          0.5779 #>  #> [[3]] #>      Target vs. 1970 #> PS            0.0925 #> CC            0.9798 #> AMB           0.4373 #> MB            0.0000 #> RMSB          0.5701 #>  #> [[4]] #>      Target vs. 1980 #> PS            0.0771 #> CC            0.9813 #> AMB           0.3903 #> MB            0.0000 #> RMSB          0.5501 #>  #> [[5]] #>      Target vs. 1990 #> PS            0.0812 #> CC            0.9793 #> AMB         0.6564 #>  #> [[7]] #>      Target vs. 2010 #> PS            0.0797 #> CC            0.9813 #> AMB           0.4337 #> MB            0.0000 #> RMSB          0.5428 #>  #> [[8]] #>      Target vs. 2020 #> PS            0.0695 #> CC            0.9814 #> AMB           0.3914 #> MB            0.0000 #> RMSB          0.5069 #>  results$fit.plot  results$bias.plot   data(Africa_climate) data(Africa_climate_target) bp <- biplotEZ::biplot(Africa_climate, scaled = TRUE) |> biplotEZ::PCA() results <- bp |> moveplot3(time.var = "Year", group.var = "Region", hulls = TRUE, move = FALSE, target = Africa_climate_target) |> evaluation()  results$eval.list #> [[1]] #>      Target vs. 1950 #> PS            0.2112 #> CC            0.9556 #> AMB           0.4976 #> MB            0.0000 #> RMSB          0.6549 #>  #> [[2]] #>      Target vs. 1960 #> PS            0.1738 #> CC            0.9559 #> AMB           1.6285 #> MB            0.0000 #> RMSB          2.3374 #>  #> [[3]] #> CC            0.9604 #> AMB           1.5816 #> MB            0.0000 #> RMSB          2.3185 #>  #> [[5]] #>      Target vs. 1990 #> PS            0.1698 #> CC            0.9603 #> AMB title: moveEZ: Animated Biplots ‚Äî moveEZ-package
text: Create animated biplots enables dynamic visualisation temporal sequential changes multivariate data animating single biplot across levels time variable. builds objects 'biplotEZ' package, Lubbe S, le Roux N, Nienkemper-Swanepoel J, Ganey R, Buys R, Adams Z, Manefeldt P (2024) doi:10.32614/CRAN.package.biplotEZ , allowing users create animated biplots reveal samples variables evolve time.

title: moveEZ: Animated Biplots ‚Äî moveEZ-package
text: Maintainer: Raeesa Ganey raeesa.ganey@wits.ac.za (ORCID) [copyright holder] Authors: Johan√© Nienkemper-Swanepoel nienkemperj@sun.ac.za (ORCID) [copyright holder]

title: Move plot ‚Äî moveplot
text: Create animated biplot samples biplot

title: Move plot ‚Äî moveplot
code: moveplot(bp, time.var, group.var, move = TRUE, hulls = TRUE, scale.var = 5)

title: Move plot ‚Äî moveplot
text: bp biplot object biplotEZ time.var time variable group.var group variable move whether animate (TRUE) facet (FALSE) samples, according time.var hulls whether display sample points convex hulls scale.var scaling vectors representing variables

title: Move plot ‚Äî moveplot
text: bp Returns elements biplot object bp biplotEZ. plot animated facet biplots based dynamic frame.

title: Move plot ‚Äî moveplot
code: data(Africa_climate) bp <- biplotEZ::biplot(Africa_climate, scaled = TRUE) |> biplotEZ::PCA() bp |> moveplot(time.var = "Year", group.var = "Region", hulls = TRUE, move = FALSE)  #> Object of class biplot, based on 960 samples and 9 variables. #> 6 numeric variables. #> 3 categorical variables. bp |> moveplot(time.var = "Year", group.var = "Region", hulls = FALSE, move = FALSE)  #> Object of class biplot, based on 960 samples and 9 variables. #> 6 numeric variables. #> 3 categorical variables. # \donttest{ if(interactive()) { bp |> moveplot(time.var = "Year", group.var = "Region", hulls = TRUE, move = TRUE)}# }

title: Move plot 2 ‚Äî moveplot2
text: Create animated biplot samples variables biplot

title: Move plot 2 ‚Äî moveplot2
code: moveplot2(   bp,   time.var,   group.var,   move = TRUE,   hulls = TRUE,   scale.var = 5,   align.time = NA,   reflect = NA )

title: Move plot 2 ‚Äî moveplot2
text: bp biplot object biplotEZ time.var time variable group.var group variable move whether animate (TRUE) facet (FALSE) samples variables, according time.var hulls whether display sample points convex hulls scale.var scaling vectors representing variables align.time vector specifying levels time.var biplots aligned. biplots corresponding time points used compute alignment transformation. reflect character vector specifying axis reflection apply corresponding time point align.time. One FALSE (default), "x" reflection x-axis, "y" reflection y-axis "xy" reflection axes.

title: Move plot 2 ‚Äî moveplot2
text: bp Returns elements biplot object bp biplotEZ. plot animated facet biplots based dynamic frame.

title: Move plot 2 ‚Äî moveplot2
code: data(Africa_climate) bp <- biplotEZ::biplot(Africa_climate, scaled = TRUE) |> biplotEZ::PCA() # \donttest{ if(interactive()) { bp |> moveplot2(time.var = "Year", group.var = "Region", hulls = TRUE, move = TRUE)}# }

title: Move plot 3 ‚Äî moveplot3
text: Create animated biplot samples variables biplot given target

title: Move plot 3 ‚Äî moveplot3
code: moveplot3(   bp,   time.var,   group.var,   move = TRUE,   hulls = TRUE,   scale.var = 5,   target = NULL )

title: Move plot 3 ‚Äî moveplot3
text: bp biplot object biplotEZ time.var time variable group.var group variable move whether animate (TRUE) facet (FALSE) samples variables, according time.var hulls whether display sample points convex hulls scale.var scaling vectors representing variables target Target data set biplots matched consisting dimensions. specified, centroid available biplot sample coordinates time.var used. Default NULL.

title: Move plot 3 ‚Äî moveplot3
text: bp Returns elements biplot object bp biplotEZ. iter_levels levels time variable. coord_set coordinates configurations applying Generalised Orthogonal Procrustes Analysis. GPA_list coordinates configurations applying Generalised Orthogonal Procrustes Analysis. plot animated facet biplots based dynamic frame.

title: Move plot 3 ‚Äî moveplot3
code: data(Africa_climate) data(Africa_climate_target) bp <- biplotEZ::biplot(Africa_climate, scaled = TRUE) |> biplotEZ::PCA() bp |> moveplot3(time.var = "Year", group.var = "Region", hulls = TRUE, move = FALSE, target = NULL)  #> Object of class biplot, based on 960 samples and 9 variables. #> 6 numeric variables. #> 3 categorical variables. # \donttest{ if(interactive()) { bp |> moveplot3(time.var = "Year", group.var = "Region", hulls = TRUE, move = TRUE, target = NULL)}# } bp |> moveplot3(time.var = "Year", group.var = "Region", hulls = TRUE, move = FALSE, target = Africa_climate_target)  #> Object of class biplot, based on 960 samples and 9 variables. #> 6 numeric variables. #> 3 categorical variables.
